result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Bradford S. Beach was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Juror's notes with Judge's response.

Defendant Bradford S. Beach in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for day 2 of trial.  Defense presents Exhibit #7, marked and received.  Defense stipulates to 4 prior convictions for defendant.  

Jury enters the courtroom at 8:43 am.  Denise Freigang sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the defense.  Cross-examination by State.  Witness is released.  Jury is excused at 8:59 am.

Court conducts colloquy with defense regarding defendant's testimony.  Defendant will not testify.  Defense rests.  State rests.  Court closes evidence.  No motions by either party.  Court addresses jury instructions and jury verdict with parties.  

Jury recalled at 9:23 am.  Court gives jury instructions to jurors.  State presents closing arguments.  Defense presents closing arguments.  State presents final arguments.  Court gives final instructions to the jurors.  Clerk swears in bailiff.  Jurors leave courtroom for deliberations at 10:06 am.  Jurors have question at 10:40 am.  Court has counsel return and recalls case at 10:51 am.  Court responds back on their note. 

Jurors have reached a verdict at 1:12 pm.  Jurors enter the courtroom at 1:31 pm.  Court reads the verdict.  Jurors find the defendant guilty on both counts.  Jurors are excused at 1:34 pm.

State moves for judgment on the OWI and dismisses the PAC.  Court grants.  

State makes sentencing argument.  Defense makes sentencing argument.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.

*D/L REVOCATION: 33 months.

*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 33 months.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (apply cash bail; balance to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department);

TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $16.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to District Attorney (apply cash bail; balance to be paid as a condition of probation)

FINE:  $2,608.00 (apply cash bail; balance to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (apply cash bail; balance to be paid as a condition of probation)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

CONDITION TIME:  12 months Huber with release for work and/or treatment (Credit - 268).  Eligible for good time credit.  Defendant remanded to custody forthwith.  

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Trial exhibits 1-5
Continuation and Stipulation for Return/Destruction of Exhibits
Voir Dire List
Random Listing Report - Voir Dire and Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges

Defendant Bradford S. Beach in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses previous convictions of State's witness, Heather W., and defendant.  State makes statement.  Defense makes statement.  Court will allow 12 convictions as to witness Heather W.  Court withholds ruling on defendant's previous convictions.  Court addresses defendant's witness who is not available for testimony until 4/5/17.  

Case called for 12-person jury trial.  Clerk swears in jurors.  Court conducts voir dire.  Voir dire by State.   Voir dire by defense.   Defense calls for sidebar.  Sidebar held.  Court strikes Juror #32, Ryan O.  New juror called.  Court strikes Juror #74, Susan S.  New juror called.  Parties conduct peremptory challenges.  Court further instructs jurors.  Clerk announces 12 selected jurors.  Remaining jurors dismissed at 10:24.  Clerk swears in 12 selected jurors to try the issue.  Court takes a short recess at 10:27.

Court reconvenes at 10:37.  State makes opening statements.  Defense makes opening statement.  Heather W., in custody, sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibit #1, marked.  Cross-examination by defense.  Redirect by State.  Exhibit #1 received.  Officer Bryan Spakowicz of the City of Waukesha police deputy sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  Cross-examination by defense.  

Officer Roosevelt Mullins of the City of Waukesha police department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibit #2 and #4, marked and received.  Court breaks for lunch at 12:05.  Jury ordered to return by 1:15.

Court reconvenes at 1:23.  State requests to reopen direct examination of Officer Mullins based on new evidence.  Defense objects.  Court will allow brief recess for defense to investigate new evidence.  Defense investigates evidence.  State and defense confer.  Defense requests brief recess to meet with defendant.  Court grants. 

Court reconvenes.  Defense objects to new evidence.  Court takes note.  Jury returns to the courtroom at 1:41.  State continues with direct examination of Officer Mullins.  State presents Exhibit #6, marked.  Defense objects to exhibit.  Court withholds ruling.  Exhibit #6 received.  Cross-examination by defense.  Defense presents Exhibit #3, marked.  Redirect by State.  

Specialist Dave Platta of the City of Waukesha police department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  Cross-examination by defense.  Redirect by State.  Re-cross by defense.  Exhibit #3 received.  Jurors excused at 2:35.  State questions if witnesses can be excused.  Defense objects.  Witnesses are to remain today.  Court takes a short recess at 2:37.  

Court reconvenes at 2:48.  Defense requests exhibit be marked in a redacted version.  State does not object.  Court will allow.  Jurors return at 2:50.

Jennifer Greene sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibit #5, marked and received.  Cross-examination by defense.  State rests.  Jurors released at 3:42 and ordered to return at 8:15 a.m.  tomorrow.

Defense will not be recalling any witnesses.  Defense objects as to the exhibits.  Court overrules.  Court will allow 6 convictions as to the defendant.

Defendant Bradford S. Beach in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are ready to proceed to trial.  Defense anticipates this will be a 2-day trial.  It will be the #1 trial.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
The Court is granting the Defendant's request to withdraw the motion and the motion hearing is cancelled.  JSH and JT remain on schedule
